verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O God, the proud are risen up against me,
And a company of violent men have sought after my soul,
And have not set thee before them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But thou, O Lord, art a God merciful and gracious,
Slow to anger, and abundant in lovingkindness and truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Show me a token for good,
That they who hate me may see it, and be put to shame,
Because thou, Jehovah, hast helped me, and comforted me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His foundation is in the holy mountains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jehovah loveth the gates of Zion
More than all the dwellings of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Glorious things are spoken of thee, O city of God. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will make mention of Rahab and Babylon as among them that know me:
Behold, Philistia, and Tyre, with Ethiopia:
This one was born there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yea, of Zion it shall be said, This one and that one was born in her;
And the Most High himself will establish her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jehovah will count, when he writeth up the peoples,
This one was born there. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They that sing as well as they that dance shall say,
All my fountains are in thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Jehovah, the God of my salvation,
I have cried day and night before thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let my prayer enter into thy presence;
Incline thine ear unto my cry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For my soul is full of troubles,
And my life draweth nigh unto Sheol.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am reckoned with them that go down into the pit;
I am as a man that hath no help,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Cast off among the dead,
Like the slain that lie in the grave,
Whom thou rememberest no more,
And they are cut off from thy hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou hast laid me in the lowest pit,
In dark places, in the deeps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thy wrath lieth hard upon me,
And thou hast afflicted me with all thy waves. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Wilt thou show wonders to the dead?
Shall they that are deceased arise and praise thee? Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shall thy lovingkindness be declared in the grave?
Or thy faithfulness in Destruction?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shall thy wonders be known in the dark?
And thy righteousness in the land of forgetfulness?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But unto thee, O Jehovah, have I cried;
And in the morning shall my prayer come before thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jehovah, why castest thou off my soul?
Why hidest thou thy face from me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am afflicted and ready to die from my youth up:
While I suffer thy terrors I am distracted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thy fierce wrath is gone over me;
Thy terrors have cut me off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They came round about me like water all the day long;
They compassed me about together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lover and friend hast thou put far from me,
And mine acquaintance into darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will sing of the lovingkindness of Jehovah for ever:
With my mouth will I make known thy faithfulness to all generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I have said, Mercy shall be built up for ever;
Thy faithfulness wilt thou establish in the very heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have made a covenant with my chosen,
I have sworn unto David my servant:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thy seed will I establish for ever,
And build up thy throne to all generations. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And the heavens shall praise thy wonders, O Jehovah;
Thy faithfulness also in the assembly of the holy ones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For who in the skies can be compared unto Jehovah?
Who among the sons of the mighty is like unto Jehovah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A God very terrible in the council of the holy ones,
And to be feared above all them that are round about him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Jehovah God of hosts,
Who is a mighty one, like unto thee, O Jehovah?
And thy faithfulness is round about thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou rulest the pride of the sea:
When the waves thereof arise, thou stillest them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou hast broken Rahab in pieces, as one that is slain;
Thou hast scattered thine enemies with the arm of thy strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The heavens are thine, the earth also is thine:
The world and the fulness thereof, thou hast founded them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The north and the south, thou hast created them:
Tabor and Hermon rejoice in thy name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou hast a mighty arm;
Strong is thy hand, and high is thy right hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Righteousness and justice are the foundation of thy throne:
Lovingkindness and truth go before thy face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed is the people that know the joyful sound:
They walk, O Jehovah, in the light of thy countenance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In thy name do they rejoice all the day;
And in thy righteousness are they exalted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For thou art the glory of their strength;
And in thy favor our horn shall be exalted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For our shield belongeth unto Jehovah;
And our king to the Holy One of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I have found David my servant;
With my holy oil have I anointed him:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With whom my hand shall be established;
Mine arm also shall strengthen him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The enemy shall not exact from him,
Nor the son of wickedness afflict him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And I will beat down his adversaries before him,
And smite them that hate him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But my faithfulness and my lovingkindness shall be with him;
And in my name shall his horn be exalted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will set his hand also on the sea,
And his right hand on the rivers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He shall cry unto me, Thou art my Father,
My God, and the rock of my salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I also will make him my first-born,
The highest of the kings of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My lovingkindness will I keep for him for evermore;
And my covenant shall stand fast with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His seed also will I make to endure for ever,
And his throne as the days of heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If his children forsake my law,
And walk not in mine ordinances;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If they break my statutes,
And keep not my commandments;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then will I visit their transgression with the rod,
And their iniquity with stripes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But my lovingkindness will I not utterly take from him,
Nor suffer my faithfulness to fail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My covenant will I not break,
Nor alter the thing that is gone out of my lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Once have I sworn by my holiness:
I will not lie unto David:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His seed shall endure for ever,
And his throne as the sun before me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It shall be established for ever as the moon,
And as the faithful witness in the sky. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But thou hast cast off and rejected,
Thou hast been wroth with thine anointed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou hast abhorred the covenant of thy servant:
Thou hast profaned his crown by casting it to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou hast broken down all his hedges;
Thou hast brought his strongholds to ruin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All that pass by the way rob him:
He is become a reproach to his neighbors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou hast exalted the right hand of his adversaries;
Thou hast made all his enemies to rejoice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yea, thou turnest back the edge of his sword,
And hast not made him to stand in the battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou hast made his brightness to cease,
And cast his throne down to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The days of his youth hast thou shortened:
Thou hast covered him with shame. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long, O Jehovah? wilt thou hide thyself for ever?
How long shall thy wrath burn like fire?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh remember how short my time is:
For what vanity hast thou created all the children of men!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What man is he that shall live and not see death,
That shall deliver his soul from the power of Sheol? Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, where are thy former lovingkindnesses,
Which thou swarest unto David in thy faithfulness?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remember, Lord, the reproach of thy servants;
How I do bear in my bosom the reproach of all the mighty peoples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wherewith thine enemies have reproached, O Jehovah,
Wherewith they have reproached the footsteps of thine anointed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed be Jehovah for evermore.
Amen, and Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, thou hast been our dwelling-place
In all generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Before the mountains were brought forth,
Or ever thou hadst formed the earth and the world,
Even from everlasting to everlasting, thou art God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou turnest man to destruction,
And sayest, Return, ye children of men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For a thousand years in thy sight
Are but as yesterday when it is past,
And as a watch in the night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou carriest them away as with a flood; they are as a sleep:
In the morning they are like grass which groweth up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the morning it flourisheth, and groweth up;
In the evening it is cut down, and withereth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For we are consumed in thine anger,
And in thy wrath are we troubled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou hast set our iniquities before thee,
Our secret sins in the light of thy countenance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For all our days are passed away in thy wrath:
We bring our years to an end as a sigh.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Who knoweth the power of thine anger,
And thy wrath according to the fear that is due unto thee?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So teach us to number our days,
That we may get us a heart of wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Return, O Jehovah; how long?
And let it repent thee concerning thy servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh satisfy us in the morning with thy lovingkindness,
That we may rejoice and be glad all our days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Make us glad according to the days wherein thou hast afflicted us,
And the years wherein we have seen evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let thy work appear unto thy servants,
And thy glory upon their children.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
He that dwelleth in the secret place of the Most High
Shall abide under the shadow of the Almighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will say of Jehovah, He is my refuge and my fortress;
My God, in whom I trust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he will deliver thee from the snare of the fowler,
And from the deadly pestilence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will cover thee with his pinions,
And under his wings shalt thou take refuge:
His truth is a shield and a buckler.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou shalt not be afraid for the terror by night,
Nor for the arrow that flieth by day;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the pestilence that walketh in darkness,
Nor for the destruction that wasteth at noonday.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Only with thine eyes shalt thou behold,
And see the reward of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For thou, O Jehovah, art my refuge!
Thou hast made the Most High thy habitation;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There shall no evil befall thee,
Neither shall any plague come nigh thy tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he will give his angels charge over thee,
To keep thee in all thy ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They shall bear thee up in their hands,
Lest thou dash thy foot against a stone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou shalt tread upon the lion and adder:
The young lion and the serpent shalt thou trample under foot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because he hath set his love upon me, therefore will I deliver him:
I will set him on high, because he hath known my name.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
With long life will I satisfy him,
And show him my salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is a good thing to give thanks unto Jehovah,
And to sing praises unto thy name, O Most High;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To show forth thy lovingkindness in the morning,
And thy faithfulness every night,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With an instrument of ten strings, and with the psaltery;
With a solemn sound upon the harp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For thou, Jehovah, hast made me glad through thy work:
I will triumph in the works of thy hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How great are thy works, O Jehovah!
Thy thoughts are very deep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A brutish man knoweth not;
Neither doth a fool understand this:
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: But thou, O Jehovah, art on high for evermore.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
But my horn hast thou exalted like the horn of the wild-ox:
I am anointed with fresh oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Mine eye also hath seen my desire on mine enemies,
Mine ears have heard my desire of the evil-doers that rise up against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteous shall flourish like the palm-tree:
He shall grow like a cedar in Lebanon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are planted in the house of Jehovah;
They shall flourish in the courts of our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They shall still bring forth fruit in old age;
They shall be full of sap and green:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To show that Jehovah is upright;
He is my rock, and there is no unrighteousness in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Thy throne is established of old:
Thou art from everlasting.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Above the voices of many waters,
The mighty breakers of the sea,
Jehovah on high is mighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thy testimonies are very sure:
Holiness becometh thy house,
O Jehovah, for evermore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Jehovah, thou God to whom vengeance belongeth,
Thou God to whom vengeance belongeth, shine forth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lift up thyself, thou judge of the earth:
Render to the proud their desert.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jehovah, how long shall the wicked,
How long shall the wicked triumph?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They prate, they speak arrogantly:
All the workers of iniquity boast themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They break in pieces thy people, O Jehovah,
And afflict thy heritage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They slay the widow and the sojourner,
And murder the fatherless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And they say, Jehovah will not see,
Neither will the God of Jacob consider.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Consider, ye brutish among the people;
And ye fools, when will ye be wise?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He that planted the ear, shall he not hear?
He that formed the eye, shall he not see?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He that chastiseth the nations, shall not he correct,
Even he that teacheth man knowledge?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jehovah knoweth the thoughts of man,
That they are vanity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed is the man whom thou chastenest, O Jehovah,
And teachest out of thy law;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That thou mayest give him rest from the days of adversity,
Until the pit be digged for the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For Jehovah will not cast off his people,
Neither will he forsake his inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For judgment shall return unto righteousness;
And all the upright in heart shall follow it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who will rise up for me against the evil-doers?
Who will stand up for me against the workers of iniquity?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Unless Jehovah had been my help,
My soul had soon dwelt in silence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I said, My foot slippeth;
Thy lovingkindness, O Jehovah, held me up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the multitude of my thoughts within me Thy comforts delight my soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shall the throne of wickedness have fellowship with thee,
Which frameth mischief by statute?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They gather themselves together against the soul of the righteous,
And condemn the innocent blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But Jehovah hath been my high tower,
And my God the rock of my refuge.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Oh come, let us sing unto Jehovah;
Let us make a joyful noise to the rock of our salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let us come before his presence with thanksgiving;
Let us make a joyful noise unto him with psalms.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For Jehovah is a great God,
And a great King above all gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In his hand are the deep places of the earth;
The heights of the mountains are his also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sea is his, and he made it;
And his hands formed the dry land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh come, let us worship and bow down;
Let us kneel before Jehovah our Maker:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he is our God,
And we are the people of his pasture, and the sheep of his hand.
To-day, oh that ye would hear his voice!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Harden not your heart, as at Meribah,
As in the day of Massah in the wilderness;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When your fathers tempted me,
Proved me, and saw my work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Forty years long was I grieved with that generation,
And said, It is a people that do err in their heart,
And they have not known my ways:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wherefore I sware in my wrath,
That they should not enter into my rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh sing unto Jehovah a new song:
Sing unto Jehovah, all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing unto Jehovah, bless his name;
Show forth his salvation from day to day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Declare his glory among the nations,
His marvellous works among all the peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For great is Jehovah, and greatly to be praised:
He is to be feared above all gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For all the gods of the peoples are idols;
But Jehovah made the heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Honor and majesty are before him:
Strength and beauty are in his sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ascribe unto Jehovah, ye kindreds of the peoples,
Ascribe unto Jehovah glory and strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ascribe unto Jehovah the glory due unto his name:
Bring an offering, and come into his courts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh worship Jehovah in holy array:
Tremble before him, all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Say among the nations, Jehovah reigneth:
The world also is established that it cannot be moved:
He will judge the peoples with equity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the heavens be glad, and let the earth rejoice;
Let the sea roar, and the fulness thereof;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the field exult, and all that is therein;
Then shall all the trees of the wood sing for joy
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Before Jehovah; for he cometh,
For he cometh to judge the earth:
He will judge the world with righteousness,
And the peoples with his truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jehovah reigneth; let the earth rejoice;
Let the multitude of isles be glad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Clouds and darkness are round about him:
Righteousness and justice are the foundation of his throne.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A fire goeth before him,
And burneth up his adversaries round about.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His lightnings lightened the world:
The earth saw, and trembled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The mountains melted like wax at the presence of Jehovah,
At the presence of the Lord of the whole earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The heavens declare his righteousness,
And all the peoples have seen his glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let all them be put to shame that serve graven images,
That boast themselves of idols:
Worship him, all ye gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Zion heard and was glad,
And the daughters of Judah rejoiced,
Because of thy judgments, O Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For thou, Jehovah, art most high above all the earth:
Thou art exalted far above all gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Light is sown for the righteous,
And gladness for the upright in heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be glad in Jehovah, ye righteous;
And give thanks to his holy memorial name.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Jehovah hath made known his salvation:
His righteousness hath he openly showed in the sight of the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He hath remembered his lovingkindness and his faithfulness toward the house of Israel:
All the ends of the earth have seen the salvation of our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Make a joyful noise unto Jehovah, all the earth:
Break forth and sing for joy, yea, sing praises.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing praises unto Jehovah with the harp;
With the harp and the voice of melody.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With trumpets and sound of cornet
Make a joyful noise before the King, Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the sea roar, and the fulness thereof;
The world, and they that dwell therein;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the floods clap their hands;
Let the hills sing for joy together
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Before Jehovah; for he cometh to judge the earth:
He will judge the world with righteousness,
And the peoples with equity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jehovah reigneth; let the peoples tremble:
He sitteth above the cherubim; let the earth be moved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jehovah is great in Zion;
And he is high above all the peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them praise thy great and terrible name:
Holy is he.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Exalt ye Jehovah our God,
And worship at his footstool:
Holy is he.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
He spake unto them in the pillar of cloud:
They kept his testimonies,
And the statute that he gave them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou answeredst them, O Jehovah our God:
Thou wast a God that forgavest them,
Though thou tookest vengeance of their doings.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: Make a joyful noise unto Jehovah, all ye lands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Serve Jehovah with gladness:
Come before his presence with singing.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Enter into his gates with thanksgiving,
And into his courts with praise:
Give thanks unto him, and bless his name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For Jehovah is good; his lovingkindness endureth for ever,
And his faithfulness unto all generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will sing of lovingkindness and justice:
Unto thee, O Jehovah, will I sing praises.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will behave myself wisely in a perfect way:
Oh when wilt thou come unto me?
I will walk within my house with a perfect heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
A perverse heart shall depart from me:
I will know no evil thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoso privily slandereth his neighbor, him will I destroy:
Him that hath a high look and a proud heart will I not suffer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Mine eyes shall be upon the faithful of the land, that they may dwell with me:
He that walketh in a perfect way, he shall minister unto me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He that worketh deceit shall not dwell within my house:
He that speaketh falsehood shall not be established before mine eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Morning by morning will I destroy all the wicked of the land;
To cut off all the workers of iniquity from the city of Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear my prayer, O Jehovah,
And let my cry come unto thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For my days consume away like smoke,
And my bones are burned as a firebrand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My heart is smitten like grass, and withered;
For I forget to eat my bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By reason of the voice of my groaning
My bones cleave to my flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am like a pelican of the wilderness;
I am become as an owl of the waste places.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I watch, and am become like a sparrow
That is alone upon the house-top.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Mine enemies reproach me all the day;
They that are mad against me do curse by me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I have eaten ashes like bread,
And mingled my drink with weeping,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because of thine indignation and thy wrath:
For thou hast taken me up, and cast me away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My days are like a shadow that declineth;
And I am withered like grass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But thou, O Jehovah, wilt abide for ever;
And thy memorial name unto all generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For thy servants take pleasure in her stones,
And have pity upon her dust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So the nations shall fear the name of Jehovah,
And all the kings of the earth thy glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For Jehovah hath built up Zion;
He hath appeared in his glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He hath regarded the prayer of the destitute,
And hath not despised their prayer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This shall be written for the generation to come;
And a people which shall be created shall praise Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he hath looked down from the height of his sanctuary;
From heaven did Jehovah behold the earth;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To hear the sighing of the prisoner;
To loose those that are appointed to death;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That men may declare the name of Jehovah in Zion,
And his praise in Jerusalem;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the peoples are gathered together,
And the kingdoms, to serve Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He weakened my strength in the way;
He shortened my days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I said, O my God, take me not away in the midst of my days:
Thy years are throughout all generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Of old didst thou lay the foundation of the earth;
And the heavens are the work of thy hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
But thou art the same,
And thy years shall have no end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The children of thy servants shall continue,
And their seed shall be established before thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bless Jehovah, O my soul;
And all that is within me, bless his holy name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bless Jehovah, O my soul,
And forget not all his benefits:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who forgiveth all thine iniquities;
Who healeth all thy diseases;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who redeemeth thy life from destruction;
Who crowneth thee with lovingkindness and tender mercies;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who satisfieth thy desire with good things,
So that thy youth is renewed like the eagle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jehovah executeth righteous acts,
And judgments for all that are oppressed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He made known his ways unto Moses,
His doings unto the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jehovah is merciful and gracious,
Slow to anger, and abundant in lovingkindness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will not always chide;
Neither will he keep his anger for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He hath not dealt with us after our sins,
Nor rewarded us after our iniquities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For as the heavens are high above the earth,
So great is his lovingkindness toward them that fear him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As far as the east is from the west,
So far hath he removed our transgressions from us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Like as a father pitieth his children,
So Jehovah pitieth them that fear him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he knoweth our frame;
He remembereth that we are dust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As for man, his days are as grass;
As a flower of the field, so he flourisheth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the wind passeth over it, and it is gone;
And the place thereof shall know it no more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But the lovingkindness of Jehovah is from everlasting to everlasting upon them that fear him,
And his righteousness unto childrenâ€™s children;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To such as keep his covenant,
And to those that remember his precepts to do them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jehovah hath established his throne in the heavens;
And his kingdom ruleth over all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bless Jehovah, ye his angels,
That are mighty in strength, that fulfil his word,
Hearkening unto the voice of his word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bless Jehovah, all ye his hosts,
Ye ministers of his, that do his pleasure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bless Jehovah, all ye his works,
In all places of his dominion:
Bless Jehovah, O my soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Who coverest thyself with light as with a garment;
Who stretchest out the heavens like a curtain;
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Who maketh winds his messengers;
Flames of fire his ministers;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who laid the foundations of the earth,
That it should not be moved for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou coveredst it with the deep as with a vesture;
The waters stood above the mountains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
At thy rebuke they fled;
At the voice of thy thunder they hasted away
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
(The mountains rose, the valleys sank down)
Unto the place which thou hadst founded for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou hast set a bound that they may not pass over;
That they turn not again to cover the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He sendeth forth springs into the valleys;
They run among the mountains;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They give drink to every beast of the field;
The wild asses quench their thirst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By them the birds of the heavens have their habitation;
They sing among the branches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He watereth the mountains from his chambers:
The earth is filled with the fruit of thy works.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
And wine that maketh glad the heart of man,
And oil to make his face to shine,
And bread that strengtheneth manâ€™s heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The trees of Jehovah are filled with moisture,
The cedars of Lebanon, which he hath planted;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Where the birds make their nests:
As for the stork, the fir-trees are her house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The high mountains are for the wild goats;
The rocks are a refuge for the conies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He appointed the moon for seasons:
The sun knoweth his going down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou makest darkness, and it is night,
Wherein all the beasts of the forest creep forth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The young lions roar after their prey,
And seek their food from God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sun ariseth, they get them away,
And lay them down in their dens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Man goeth forth unto his work
And to his labor until the evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Jehovah, how manifold are thy works!
In wisdom hast thou made them all:
The earth is full of thy riches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yonder is the sea, great and wide,
Wherein are things creeping innumerable,
Both small and great beasts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There go the ships;
There is leviathan, whom thou hast formed to play therein.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
These wait all for thee,
That thou mayest give them their food in due season.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou givest unto them, they gather;
Thou openest thy hand, they are satisfied with good.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Thou sendest forth thy Spirit, they are created;
And thou renewest the face of the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the glory of Jehovah endure for ever;
Let Jehovah rejoice in his works:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who looketh on the earth, and it trembleth;
He toucheth the mountains, and they smoke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will sing unto Jehovah as long as I live:
I will sing praise to my God while I have any being.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let my meditation be sweet unto him:
I will rejoice in Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let sinners be consumed out of the earth.
And let the wicked be no more.
Bless Jehovah, O my soul.
Praise ye Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh give thanks unto Jehovah, call upon his name;
Make known among the peoples his doings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing unto him, sing praises unto him;
Talk ye of all his marvellous works.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Glory ye in his holy name:
Let the heart of them rejoice that seek Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Seek ye Jehovah and his strength;
Seek his face evermore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remember his marvellous works that he hath done,
His wonders, and the judgments of his mouth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O ye seed of Abraham his servant,
Ye children of Jacob, his chosen ones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He is Jehovah our God:
His judgments are in all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He hath remembered his covenant for ever,
The word which he commanded to a thousand generations,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The covenant which he made with Abraham,
And his oath unto Isaac,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And confirmed the same unto Jacob for a statute,
To Israel for an everlasting covenant,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Saying, Unto thee will I give the land of Canaan,
The lot of your inheritance;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When they were but a few men in number,
Yea, very few, and sojourners in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And they went about from nation to nation,
From one kingdom to another people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He suffered no man to do them wrong;
Yea, he reproved kings for their sakes,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Saying, Touch not mine anointed ones,
And do my prophets no harm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he called for a famine upon the land;
He brake the whole staff of bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He sent a man before them;
Joseph was sold for a servant:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His feet they hurt with fetters:
He was laid in chains of iron,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Until the time that his word came to pass,
The word of Jehovah tried him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The king sent and loosed him;
Even the ruler of peoples, and let him go free.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He made him lord of his house,
And ruler of all his substance;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To bind his princes at his pleasure,
And teach his elders wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Israel also came into Egypt;
And Jacob sojourned in the land of Ham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he increased his people greatly,
And made them stronger than their adversaries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He turned their heart to hate his people,
To deal subtly with his servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He sent Moses his servant,
And Aaron whom he had chosen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They set among them his signs,
And wonders in the land of Ham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He sent darkness, and made it dark;
And they rebelled not against his words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He turned their waters into blood,
And slew their fish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their land swarmed with frogs
In the chambers of their kings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He spake, and there came swarms of flies,
And lice in all their borders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He gave them hail for rain,
And flaming fire in their land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He smote their vines also and their fig-trees,
And brake the trees of their borders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He spake, and the locust came,
And the grasshopper, and that without number,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And did eat up every herb in their land,
And did eat up the fruit of their ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He smote also all the first-born in their land,
The chief of all their strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he brought them forth with silver and gold;
And there was not one feeble person among his tribes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Egypt was glad when they departed;
For the fear of them had fallen upon them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He spread a cloud for a covering,
And fire to give light in the night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They asked, and he brought quails,
And satisfied them with the bread of heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He opened the rock, and waters gushed out;
They ran in the dry places like a river.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he remembered his holy word,
And Abraham his servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he brought forth his people with joy,
And his chosen with singing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he gave them the lands of the nations;
And they took the labor of the peoples in possession:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That they might keep his statutes,
And observe his laws.
Praise ye Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Who can utter the mighty acts of Jehovah,
Or show forth all his praise?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed are they that keep justice,
And he that doeth righteousness at all times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remember me, O Jehovah, with the favor that thou bearest unto thy people;
Oh visit me with thy salvation,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That I may see the prosperity of thy chosen,
That I may rejoice in the gladness of thy nation,
That I may glory with thine inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We have sinned with our fathers,
We have committed iniquity, we have done wickedly.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Nevertheless he saved them for his nameâ€™s sake,
That he might make his mighty power to be known.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He rebuked the Red Sea also, and it was dried up:
So he led them through the depths, as through a wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he saved them from the hand of him that hated them,
And redeemed them from the hand of the enemy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And the waters covered their adversaries;
There was not one of them left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then believed they his words;
They sang his praise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They soon forgat his works;
They waited not for his counsel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But lusted exceedingly in the wilderness,
And tempted God in the desert.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he gave them their request,
But sent leanness into their soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They envied Moses also in the camp,
And Aaron the saint of Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The earth opened and swallowed up Dathan,
And covered the company of Abiram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And a fire was kindled in their company;
The flame burned up the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They made a calf in Horeb,
And worshipped a molten image.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus they changed their glory
For the likeness of an ox that eateth grass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They forgat God their Saviour,
Who had done great things in Egypt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wondrous works in the land of Ham,
And terrible things by the Red Sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore he said that he would destroy them,
Had not Moses his chosen stood before him in the breach,
To turn away his wrath, lest he should destroy them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yea, they despised the pleasant land,
They believed not his word,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But murmured in their tents,
And hearkened not unto the voice of Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore he sware unto them,
That he would overthrow them in the wilderness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And that he would overthrow their seed among the nations,
And scatter them in the lands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They joined themselves also unto Baal-peor,
And ate the sacrifices of the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus they provoked him to anger with their doings;
And the plague brake in upon them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then stood up Phinehas, and executed judgment;
And so the plague was stayed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And that was reckoned unto him for righteousness,
Unto all generations for evermore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They angered him also at the waters of Meribah,
So that it went ill with Moses for their sakes;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because they were rebellious against his spirit,
And he spake unadvisedly with his lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They did not destroy the peoples,
As Jehovah commanded them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But mingled themselves with the nations,
And learned their works,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And served their idols,
Which became a snare unto them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yea, they sacrificed their sons and their daughters unto demons,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And shed innocent blood,
Even the blood of their sons and of their daughters,
Whom they sacrificed unto the idols of Canaan;
And the land was polluted with blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus were they defiled with their works,
And played the harlot in their doings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore was the wrath of Jehovah kindled against his people,
And he abhorred his inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he gave them into the hand of the nations;
And they that hated them ruled over them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their enemies also oppressed them,
And they were brought into subjection under their hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Nevertheless he regarded their distress,
When he heard their cry:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he remembered for them his covenant,
And repented according to the multitude of his lovingkindnesses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He made them also to be pitied
Of all those that carried them captive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Save us, O Jehovah our God,
And gather us from among the nations,
To give thanks unto thy holy name,
And to triumph in thy praise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed be Jehovah, the God of Israel,
From everlasting even to everlasting.
And let all the people say, Amen.
Praise ye Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh give thanks unto Jehovah; for he is good;
For his lovingkindness endureth for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the redeemed of Jehovah say so,
Whom he hath redeemed from the hand of the adversary,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And gathered out of the lands,
From the east and from the west,
From the north and from the south.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They wandered in the wilderness in a desert way;
They found no city of habitation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hungry and thirsty,
Their soul fainted in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they cried unto Jehovah in their trouble,
And he delivered them out of their distresses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He led them also by a straight way,
That they might go to a city of habitation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh that men would praise Jehovah for his lovingkindness,
And for his wonderful works to the children of men!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he satisfieth the longing soul,
And the hungry soul he filleth with good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Such as sat in darkness and in the shadow of death,
Being bound in affliction and iron,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because they rebelled against the words of God,
And contemned the counsel of the Most High:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore he brought down their heart with labor;
They fell down, and there was none to help.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they cried unto Jehovah in their trouble,
And he saved them out of their distresses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He brought them out of darkness and the shadow of death,
And brake their bonds in sunder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh that men would praise Jehovah for his lovingkindness,
And for his wonderful works to the children of men!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he hath broken the gates of brass,
And cut the bars of iron in sunder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Fools because of their transgression,
And because of their iniquities, are afflicted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their soul abhorreth all manner of food;
And they draw near unto the gates of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they cry unto Jehovah in their trouble,
And he saveth them out of their distresses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He sendeth his word, and healeth them,
And delivereth them from their destructions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh that men would praise Jehovah for his lovingkindness,
And for his wonderful works to the children of men!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And let them offer the sacrifices of thanksgiving,
And declare his works with singing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They that go down to the sea in ships,
That do business in great waters;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
These see the works of Jehovah,
And his wonders in the deep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he commandeth, and raiseth the stormy wind,
Which lifteth up the waves thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They mount up to the heavens, they go down again to the depths:
Their soul melteth away because of trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They reel to and fro, and stagger like a drunken man,
And are at their witsâ€™ end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they cry unto Jehovah in their trouble,
And he bringeth them out of their distresses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He maketh the storm a calm,
So that the waves thereof are still.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then are they glad because they are quiet;
So he bringeth them unto their desired haven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh that men would praise Jehovah for his lovingkindness,
And for his wonderful works to the children of men!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them exalt him also in the assembly of the people,
And praise him in the seat of the elders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He turneth rivers into a wilderness,
And watersprings into a thirsty ground;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A fruitful land into a salt desert,
For the wickedness of them that dwell therein.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He turneth a wilderness into a pool of water,
And a dry land into watersprings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And there he maketh the hungry to dwell,
That they may prepare a city of habitation,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And sow fields, and plant vineyards,
And get them fruits of increase.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He blesseth them also, so that they are multiplied greatly;
And he suffereth not their cattle to decrease.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Again, they are diminished and bowed down
Through oppression, trouble, and sorrow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He poureth contempt upon princes,
And causeth them to wander in the waste, where there is no way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet setteth he the needy on high from affliction,
And maketh him families like a flock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The upright shall see it, and be glad;
And all iniquity shall stop her mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoso is wise will give heed to these things;
And they will consider the lovingkindnesses of Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My heart is fixed, O God;
I will sing, yea, I will sing praises, even with my glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Awake, psaltery and harp:
I myself will awake right early.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will give thanks unto thee, O Jehovah, among the peoples;
And I will sing praises unto thee among the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For thy lovingkindness is great above the heavens;
And thy truth reacheth unto the skies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens,
And thy glory above all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That thy beloved may be delivered,
Save with thy right hand, and answer us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God hath spoken in his holiness: I will exult;
I will divide Shechem, and mete out the valley of Succoth.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Who will bring me into the fortified city?
Who hath led me unto Edom?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hast not thou cast us off, O God?
And thou goest not forth, O God, with our hosts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give us help against the adversary;
For vain is the help of man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Through God we shall do valiantly:
For he it is that will tread down our adversaries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hold not thy peace, O God of my praise;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the mouth of the wicked and the mouth of deceit have they opened against me:
They have spoken unto me with a lying tongue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have compassed me about also with words of hatred,
And fought against me without a cause.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For my love they are my adversaries:
But I give myself unto prayer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And they have rewarded me evil for good,
And hatred for my love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Set thou a wicked man over him;
And let an adversary stand at his right hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When he is judged, let him come forth guilty;
And let his prayer be turned into sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let his days be few;
And let another take his office.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let his children be fatherless,
And his wife a widow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let his children be vagabonds, and beg;
And let them seek their bread out of their desolate places.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the extortioner catch all that he hath;
And let strangers make spoil of his labor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let there be none to extend kindness unto him;
Neither let there be any to have pity on his fatherless children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let his posterity be cut off;
In the generation following let their name be blotted out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the iniquity of his fathers be remembered with Jehovah;
And let not the sin of his mother be blotted out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them be before Jehovah continually,
That he may cut off the memory of them from the earth;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because he remembered not to show kindness,
But persecuted the poor and needy man,
And the broken in heart, to slay them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yea, he loved cursing, and it came unto him;
And he delighted not in blessing, and it was far from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He clothed himself also with cursing as with his garment,
And it came into his inward parts like water,
And like oil into his bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let it be unto him as the raiment wherewith he covereth himself,
And for the girdle wherewith he is girded continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is the reward of mine adversaries from Jehovah,
And of them that speak evil against my soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But deal thou with me, O Jehovah the Lord, for thy nameâ€™s sake:
Because thy lovingkindness is good, deliver thou me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I am poor and needy,
And my heart is wounded within me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am gone like the shadow when it declineth:
I am tossed up and down as the locust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My knees are weak through fasting;
And my flesh faileth of fatness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am become also a reproach unto them:
When they see me, they shake their head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Help me, O Jehovah my God;
Oh save me according to thy lovingkindness:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That they may know that this is thy hand;
That thou, Jehovah, hast done it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them curse, but bless thou:
When they arise, they shall be put to shame,
But thy servant shall rejoice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let mine adversaries be clothed with dishonor,
And let them cover themselves with their own shame as with a robe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will give great thanks unto Jehovah with my mouth;
Yea, I will praise him among the multitude.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he will stand at the right hand of the needy,
To save him from them that judge his soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jehovah saith unto my Lord, Sit thou at my right hand,
Until I make thine enemies thy footstool.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jehovah will send forth the rod of thy strength out of Zion:
Rule thou in the midst of thine enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thy people offer themselves willingly
In the day of thy power, in holy array:
Out of the womb of the morning
Thou hast the dew of thy youth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jehovah hath sworn, and will not repent:
Thou art a priest for ever
After the order of Melchizedek.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord at thy right hand
Will strike through kings in the day of his wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
He will drink of the brook in the way:
Therefore will he lift up the head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise ye Jehovah.
I will give thanks unto Jehovah with my whole heart,
In the council of the upright, and in the congregation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The works of Jehovah are great,
Sought out of all them that have pleasure therein.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His work is honor and majesty;
And his righteousness endureth for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He hath made his wonderful works to be remembered:
Jehovah is gracious and merciful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He hath given food unto them that fear him:
He will ever be mindful of his covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He hath showed his people the power of his works,
In giving them the heritage of the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The works of his hands are truth and justice;
All his precepts are sure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are established for ever and ever;
They are done in truth and uprightness.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Praise ye Jehovah.
Blessed is the man that feareth Jehovah,
That delighteth greatly in his commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His seed shall be mighty upon earth:
The generation of the upright shall be blessed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wealth and riches are in his house;
And his righteousness endureth for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Unto the upright there ariseth light in the darkness:
He is gracious, and merciful, and righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Well is it with the man that dealeth graciously and lendeth;
He shall maintain his cause in judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he shall never be moved;
The righteous shall be had in everlasting remembrance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He shall not be afraid of evil tidings:
His heart is fixed, trusting in Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His heart is established, he shall not be afraid,
Until he see his desire upon his adversaries.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Praise ye Jehovah.
Praise, O ye servants of Jehovah,
Praise the name of Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed be the name of Jehovah
From this time forth and for evermore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From the rising of the sun unto the going down of the same
Jehovahâ€™s name is to be praised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jehovah is high above all nations,
And his glory above the heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who is like unto Jehovah our God,
That hath his seat on high,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That humbleth himself to behold
The things that are in heaven and in the earth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He raiseth up the poor out of the dust,
And lifteth up the needy from the dunghill;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That he may set him with princes,
Even with the princes of his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He maketh the barren woman to keep house,
And to be a joyful mother of children.
Praise ye Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When Israel went forth out of Egypt,
The house of Jacob from a people of strange language;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Judah became his sanctuary,
Israel his dominion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sea saw it, and fled;
The Jordan was driven back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The mountains skipped like rams,
The little hills like lambs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What aileth thee, O thou sea, that thou fleest?
Thou Jordan, that thou turnest back?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ye mountains, that ye skip like rams;
Ye little hills, like lambs?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Tremble, thou earth, at the presence of the Lord,
At the presence of the God of Jacob,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who turned the rock into a pool of water,
The flint into a fountain of waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Not unto us, O Jehovah, not unto us,
But unto thy name give glory,
For thy lovingkindness, and for thy truthâ€™s sake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wherefore should the nations say,
Where is now their God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But our God is in the heavens:
He hath done whatsoever he pleased.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their idols are silver and gold,
The work of menâ€™s hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have mouths, but they speak not;
Eyes have they, but they see not;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have ears, but they hear not;
Noses have they, but they smell not;
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They that make them shall be like unto them;
Yea, every one that trusteth in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Israel, trust thou in Jehovah:
He is their help and their shield.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O house of Aaron, trust ye in Jehovah:
He is their help and their shield.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ye that fear Jehovah, trust in Jehovah:
He is their help and their shield.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
He will bless them that fear Jehovah,
Both small and great.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jehovah increase you more and more,
You and your children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed are ye of Jehovah,
Who made heaven and earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The heavens are the heavens of Jehovah;
But the earth hath he given to the children of men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The dead praise not Jehovah,
Neither any that go down into silence;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But we will bless Jehovah
From this time forth and for evermore.
Praise ye Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I love Jehovah, because he heareth
My voice and my supplications.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because he hath inclined his ear unto me,
Therefore will I call upon him as long as I live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The cords of death compassed me,
And the pains of Sheol gat hold upon me:
I found trouble and sorrow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then called I upon the name of Jehovah:
O Jehovah, I beseech thee, deliver my soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Gracious is Jehovah, and righteous;
Yea, our God is merciful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jehovah preserveth the simple:
I was brought low, and he saved me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Return unto thy rest, O my soul;
For Jehovah hath dealt bountifully with thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For thou hast delivered my soul from death,
Mine eyes from tears,
And my feet from falling.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will walk before Jehovah
In the land of the living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I believe, for I will speak:
I was greatly afflicted:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I said in my haste,
All men are liars.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What shall I render unto Jehovah
For all his benefits toward me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will take the cup of salvation,
And call upon the name of Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will pay my vows unto Jehovah,
Yea, in the presence of all his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Precious in the sight of Jehovah
Is the death of his saints.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I will offer to thee the sacrifice of thanksgiving,
And will call upon the name of Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will pay my vows unto Jehovah,
Yea, in the presence of all his people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the courts of Jehovahâ€™s house,
In the midst of thee, O Jerusalem.
Praise ye Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh praise Jehovah, all ye nations;
Laud him, all ye peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Oh give thanks unto Jehovah; for he is good;
For his lovingkindness endureth for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let Israel now say,
That his lovingkindness endureth for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the house of Aaron now say,
That his lovingkindness endureth for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them now that fear Jehovah say,
That his lovingkindness endureth for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Out of my distress I called upon Jehovah:
Jehovah answered me and set me in a large place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jehovah is on my side; I will not fear:
What can man do unto me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jehovah is on my side among them that help me:
Therefore shall I see my desire upon them that hate me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is better to take refuge in Jehovah
Than to put confidence in man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is better to take refuge in Jehovah
Than to put confidence in princes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All nations compassed me about:
In the name of Jehovah I will cut them off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They compassed me about; yea, they compassed me about:
In the name of Jehovah I will cut them off.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Thou didst thrust sore at me that I might fall;
But Jehovah helped me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jehovah is my strength and song;
And he is become my salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The voice of rejoicing and salvation is in the tents of the righteous:
The right hand of Jehovah doeth valiantly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The right hand of Jehovah is exalted:
The right hand of Jehovah doeth valiantly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I shall not die, but live,
And declare the works of Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jehovah hath chastened me sore;
But he hath not given me over unto death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Open to me the gates of righteousness:
I will enter into them, I will give thanks unto Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is the gate of Jehovah;
The righteous shall enter into it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will give thanks unto thee; for thou hast answered me,
And art become my salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The stone which the builders rejected
Is become the head of the corner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is Jehovahâ€™s doing;
It is marvellous in our eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is the day which Jehovah hath made;
We will rejoice and be glad in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Save now, we beseech thee, O Jehovah:
O Jehovah, we beseech thee, send now prosperity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed be he that cometh in the name of Jehovah:
We have blessed you out of the house of Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jehovah is God, and he hath given us light:
Bind the sacrifice with cords, even unto the horns of the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou art my God, and I will give thanks unto thee:
Thou art my God, I will exalt thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh give thanks unto Jehovah; for he is good;
For his lovingkindness endureth for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed are they that are perfect in the way,
Who walk in the law of Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed are they that keep his testimonies,
That seek him with the whole heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yea, they do no unrighteousness;
They walk in his ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou hast commanded us thy precepts,
That we should observe them diligently.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh that my ways were established
To observe thy statutes!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then shall I not be put to shame,
When I have respect unto all thy commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will give thanks unto thee with uprightness of heart,
When I learn thy righteous judgments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will observe thy statutes:
Oh forsake me not utterly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wherewith shall a young man cleanse his way?
By taking heed thereto according to thy word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With my whole heart have I sought thee:
Oh let me not wander from thy commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thy word have I laid up in my heart,
That I might not sin against thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed art thou, O Jehovah:
Teach me thy statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With my lips have I declared
All the ordinances of thy mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have rejoiced in the way of thy testimonies,
As much as in all riches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will meditate on thy precepts,
And have respect unto thy ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will delight myself in thy statutes:
I will not forget thy word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Deal bountifully with thy servant, that I may live;
So will I observe thy word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Open thou mine eyes, that I may behold
Wondrous things out of thy law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am a sojourner in the earth:
Hide not thy commandments from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul breaketh for the longing
That it hath unto thine ordinances at all times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou hast rebuked the proud that are cursed,
That do wander from thy commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Take away from me reproach and contempt;
For I have kept thy testimonies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Princes also sat and talked against me;
But thy servant did meditate on thy statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thy testimonies also are my delight
And my counsellors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul cleaveth unto the dust:
Quicken thou me according to thy word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I declared my ways, and thou answeredst me:
Teach me thy statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Make me to understand the way of thy precepts:
So shall I meditate on thy wondrous works.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul melteth for heaviness:
Strengthen thou me according unto thy word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remove from me the way of falsehood;
And grant me thy law graciously.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have chosen the way of faithfulness:
Thine ordinances have I set before me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I cleave unto thy testimonies:
O Jehovah, put me not to shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will run the way of thy commandments,
When thou shalt enlarge my heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Teach me, O Jehovah, the way of thy statutes;
And I shall keep it unto the end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give me understanding, and I shall keep thy law;
Yea, I shall observe it with my whole heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Make me to go in the path of thy commandments;
For therein do I delight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Incline my heart unto thy testimonies,
And not to covetousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Turn away mine eyes from beholding vanity,
And quicken me in thy ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Confirm unto thy servant thy word,
Which is in order unto the fear of thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Turn away my reproach whereof I am afraid;
For thine ordinances are good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, I have longed after thy precepts:
Quicken me in thy righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let thy lovingkindnesses also come unto me, O Jehovah,
Even thy salvation, according to thy word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So shall I have an answer for him that reproacheth me;
For I trust in thy word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And take not the word of truth utterly out of my mouth;
For I have hoped in thine ordinances.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So shall I observe thy law continually
For ever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And I shall walk at liberty;
For I have sought thy precepts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will also speak of thy testimonies before kings,
And shall not be put to shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And I will delight myself in thy commandments,
Which I have loved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will lift up my hands also unto thy commandments, which I have loved;
And I will meditate on thy statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remember the word unto thy servant,
Because thou hast made me to hope.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is my comfort in my affliction;
For thy word hath quickened me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The proud have had me greatly in derision:
Yet have I not swerved from thy law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have remembered thine ordinances of old, O Jehovah,
And have comforted myself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hot indignation hath taken hold upon me,
Because of the wicked that forsake thy law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thy statutes have been my songs
In the house of my pilgrimage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have remembered thy name, O Jehovah, in the night,
And have observed thy law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This I have had,
Because I have kept thy precepts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jehovah is my portion:
I have said that I would observe thy words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I entreated thy favor with my whole heart:
Be merciful unto me according to thy word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I thought on my ways,
And turned my feet unto thy testimonies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I made haste, and delayed not,
To observe thy commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The cords of the wicked have wrapped me round;
But I have not forgotten thy law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
At midnight I will rise to give thanks unto thee
Because of thy righteous ordinances.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am a companion of all them that fear thee,
And of them that observe thy precepts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The earth, O Jehovah, is full of thy lovingkindness:
Teach me thy statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou hast dealt well with thy servant,
O Jehovah, according unto thy word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Teach me good judgment and knowledge;
For I have believed in thy commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Before I was afflicted I went astray;
But now I observe thy word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou art good, and doest good;
Teach me thy statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The proud have forged a lie against me:
With my whole heart will I keep thy precepts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their heart is as fat as grease;
But I delight in thy law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is good for me that I have been afflicted;
That I may learn thy statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The law of thy mouth is better unto me
Than thousands of gold and silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thy hands have made me and fashioned me:
Give me understanding, that I may learn thy commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They that fear thee shall see me and be glad,
Because I have hoped in thy word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I know, O Jehovah, that thy judgments are righteous,
And that in faithfulness thou hast afflicted me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let, I pray thee, thy lovingkindness be for my comfort,
According to thy word unto thy servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let thy tender mercies come unto me, that I may live;
For thy law is my delight.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Let those that fear thee turn unto me;
And they shall know thy testimonies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let my heart be perfect in thy statutes,
That I be not put to shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul fainteth for thy salvation;
But I hope in thy word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Mine eyes fail for thy word,
While I say, When wilt thou comfort me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I am become like a wine-skin in the smoke;
Yet do I not forget thy statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How many are the days of thy servant?
When wilt thou execute judgment on them that persecute me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The proud have digged pits for me,
Who are not according to thy law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All thy commandments are faithful:
They persecute me wrongfully; help thou me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They had almost consumed me upon earth;
But I forsook not thy precepts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Quicken me after thy lovingkindness;
So shall I observe the testimony of thy mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For ever, O Jehovah,
Thy word is settled in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thy faithfulness is unto all generations:
Thou hast established the earth, and it abideth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They abide this day according to thine ordinances;
For all things are thy servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Unless thy law had been my delight,
