I should then have perished in mine affliction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will never forget thy precepts;
For with them thou hast quickened me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am thine, save me;
For I have sought thy precepts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked have waited for me, to destroy me;
But I will consider thy testimonies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have seen an end of all perfection;
But thy commandment is exceeding broad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh how love I thy law!
It is my meditation all the day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thy commandments make me wiser than mine enemies;
For they are ever with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have more understanding than all my teachers;
For thy testimonies are my meditation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I understand more than the aged,
Because I have kept thy precepts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have refrained my feet from every evil way,
That I might observe thy word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have not turned aside from thine ordinances;
For thou hast taught me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How sweet are thy words unto my taste!
Yea, sweeter than honey to my mouth!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Through thy precepts I get understanding:
Therefore I hate every false way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thy word is a lamp unto my feet,
And light unto my path.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have sworn, and have confirmed it,
That I will observe thy righteous ordinances.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am afflicted very much:
Quicken me, O Jehovah, according unto thy word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Accept, I beseech thee, the freewill-offerings of my mouth, O Jehovah,
And teach me thine ordinances.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul is continually in my hand;
Yet do I not forget thy law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked have laid a snare for me;
Yet have I not gone astray from thy precepts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thy testimonies have I taken as a heritage for ever;
For they are the rejoicing of my heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have inclined my heart to perform thy statutes
For ever, even unto the end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I hate them that are of a double mind;
But thy law do I love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou art my hiding-place and my shield:
I hope in thy word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Depart from me, ye evil-doers,
That I may keep the commandments of my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Uphold me according unto thy word, that I may live;
And let me not be ashamed of my hope.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hold thou me up, and I shall be safe,
And shall have respect unto thy statutes continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou hast set at nought all them that err from thy statutes;
For their deceit is falsehood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou puttest away all the wicked of the earth like dross:
Therefore I love thy testimonies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My flesh trembleth for fear of thee;
And I am afraid of thy judgments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have done justice and righteousness:
Leave me not to mine oppressors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be surety for thy servant for good:
Let not the proud oppress me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Mine eyes fail for thy salvation,
And for thy righteous word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Deal with thy servant according unto thy lovingkindness,
And teach me thy statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am thy servant; give me understanding,
That I may know thy testimonies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is time for Jehovah to work;
For they have made void thy law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore I love thy commandments
Above gold, yea, above fine gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore I esteem all thy precepts concerning all things to be right;
And I hate every false way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thy testimonies are wonderful;
Therefore doth my soul keep them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The opening of thy words giveth light;
It giveth understanding unto the simple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I opened wide my mouth, and panted;
For I longed for thy commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Turn thee unto me, and have mercy upon me,
As thou usest to do unto those that love thy name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Establish my footsteps in thy word;
And let not any iniquity have dominion over me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Redeem me from the oppression of man:
So will I observe thy precepts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Make thy face to shine upon thy servant;
And teach me thy statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Streams of water run down mine eyes,
Because they observe not thy law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Righteous art thou, O Jehovah,
And upright are thy judgments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou hast commanded thy testimonies in righteousness
And very faithfulness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My zeal hath consumed me,
Because mine adversaries have forgotten thy words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thy word is very pure;
Therefore thy servant loveth it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am small and despised;
Yet do I not forget thy precepts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thy righteousness is an everlasting righteousness,
And thy law is truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Trouble and anguish have taken hold on me;
Yet thy commandments are my delight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thy testimonies are righteous for ever:
Give me understanding, and I shall live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have called with my whole heart; answer me, O Jehovah:
I will keep thy statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have called unto thee; save me,
And I shall observe thy testimonies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I anticipated the dawning of the morning, and cried:
I hoped in thy words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Mine eyes anticipated the night-watches,
That I might meditate on thy word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear my voice according unto thy lovingkindness:
Quicken me, O Jehovah, according to thine ordinances.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They draw nigh that follow after wickedness;
They are far from thy law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou art nigh, O Jehovah;
And all thy commandments are truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Of old have I known from thy testimonies,
That thou hast founded them for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Consider mine affliction, and deliver me;
For I do not forget thy law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Plead thou my cause, and redeem me:
Quicken me according to thy word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Salvation is far from the wicked;
For they seek not thy statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Great are thy tender mercies, O Jehovah:
Quicken me according to thine ordinances.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Many are my persecutors and mine adversaries;
Yet have I not swerved from thy testimonies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I beheld the treacherous, and was grieved,
Because they observe not thy word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Consider how I love thy precepts:
Quicken me, O Jehovah, according to thy lovingkindness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sum of thy word is truth;
And every one of thy righteous ordinances endureth for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Princes have persecuted me without a cause;
But my heart standeth in awe of thy words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I rejoice at thy word,
As one that findeth great spoil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I hate and abhor falsehood;
But thy law do I love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Seven times a day do I praise thee,
Because of thy righteous ordinances.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Great peace have they that love thy law;
And they have no occasion of stumbling.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have hoped for thy salvation, O Jehovah,
And have done thy commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul hath observed thy testimonies;
And I love them exceedingly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have observed thy precepts and thy testimonies;
For all my ways are before thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let my cry come near before thee, O Jehovah:
Give me understanding according to thy word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let my supplication come before thee:
Deliver me according to thy word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let my lips utter praise;
For thou teachest me thy statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let my tongue sing of thy word;
For all thy commandments are righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let thy hand be ready to help me;
For I have chosen thy precepts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have longed for thy salvation, O Jehovah;
And thy law is my delight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let my soul live, and it shall praise thee;
And let thine ordinances help me.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
In my distress I cried unto Jehovah,
And he answered me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Deliver my soul, O Jehovah, from lying lips,
And from a deceitful tongue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What shall be given unto thee, and what shall be done more unto thee,
Thou deceitful tongue?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sharp arrows of the mighty,
With coals of juniper.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Woe is me, that I sojourn in Meshech,
That I dwell among the tents of Kedar!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul hath long had her dwelling
With him that hateth peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am for peace:
But when I speak, they are for war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will lift up mine eyes unto the mountains:
From whence shall my help come?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My help cometh from Jehovah,
Who made heaven and earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will not suffer thy foot to be moved:
He that keepeth thee will not slumber.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, he that keepeth Israel
Will neither slumber nor sleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jehovah is thy keeper:
Jehovah is thy shade upon thy right hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sun shall not smite thee by day,
Nor the moon by night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jehovah will keep thee from all evil;
He will keep thy soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jehovah will keep thy going out and thy coming in
From this time forth and for evermore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I was glad when they said unto me,
Let us go unto the house of Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our feet are standing
Within thy gates, O Jerusalem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jerusalem, that art builded
As a city that is compact together;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whither the tribes go up, even the tribes of Jehovah,
For an ordinance for Israel,
To give thanks unto the name of Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For there are set thrones for judgment,
The thrones of the house of David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pray for the peace of Jerusalem:
They shall prosper that love thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Peace be within thy walls,
And prosperity within thy palaces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For my brethren and companionsâ€™ sakes,
I will now say, Peace be within thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the sake of the house of Jehovah our God
I will seek thy good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Unto thee do I lift up mine eyes,
O thou that sittest in the heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, as the eyes of servants look unto the hand of their master,
As the eyes of a maid unto the hand of her mistress;
So our eyes look unto Jehovah our God,
Until he have mercy upon us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have mercy upon us, O Jehovah, have mercy upon us;
For we are exceedingly filled with contempt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our soul is exceedingly filled
With the scoffing of those that are at ease,
And with the contempt of the proud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If it had not been Jehovah who was on our side,
Let Israel now say,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If it had not been Jehovah who was on our side,
When men rose up against us;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they had swallowed us up alive,
When their wrath was kindled against us:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the waters had overwhelmed us,
The stream had gone over our soul;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the proud waters had gone over our soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed be Jehovah,
Who hath not given us as a prey to their teeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our soul is escaped as a bird out of the snare of the fowlers:
The snare is broken, and we are escaped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our help is in the name of Jehovah,
Who made heaven and earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They that trust in Jehovah
Are as mount Zion, which cannot be moved, but abideth for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As the mountains are round about Jerusalem,
So Jehovah is round about his people
From this time forth and for evermore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the sceptre of wickedness shall not rest upon the lot of the righteous;
That the righteous put not forth their hands unto iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do good, O Jehovah, unto those that are good,
And to them that are upright in their hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But as for such as turn aside unto their crooked ways,
Jehovah will lead them forth with the workers of iniquity.
Peace be upon Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When Jehovah brought back those that returned to Zion,
We were like unto them that dream.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then was our mouth filled with laughter,
And our tongue with singing:
Then said they among the nations,
Jehovah hath done great things for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jehovah hath done great things for us,
Whereof we are glad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Turn again our captivity, O Jehovah,
As the streams in the South.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They that sow in tears shall reap in joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He that goeth forth and weepeth, bearing seed for sowing,
Shall doubtless come again with joy, bringing his sheaves with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Except Jehovah build the house,
They labor in vain that build it:
Except Jehovah keep the city,
The watchman waketh but in vain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is vain for you to rise up early,
To take rest late,
To eat the bread of toil;
For so he giveth unto his beloved sleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lo, children are a heritage of Jehovah;
And the fruit of the womb is his reward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As arrows in the hand of a mighty man,
So are the children of youth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Happy is the man that hath his quiver full of them:
They shall not be put to shame,
When they speak with their enemies in the gate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed is every one that feareth Jehovah,
That walketh in his ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For thou shalt eat the labor of thy hands:
Happy shalt thou be, and it shall be well with thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thy wife shall be as a fruitful vine,
In the innermost parts of thy house;
Thy children like olive plants,
Round about thy table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, thus shall the man be blessed
That feareth Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jehovah bless thee out of Zion:
And see thou the good of Jerusalem all the days of thy life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yea, see thou thy childrenâ€™s children.
Peace be upon Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Many a time have they afflicted me from my youth up,
Let Israel now say,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Many a time have they afflicted me from my youth up:
Yet they have not prevailed against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The plowers plowed upon my back;
They made long their furrows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jehovah is righteous:
He hath cut asunder the cords of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them be put to shame and turned backward,
All they that hate Zion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them be as the grass upon the housetops,
Which withereth before it groweth up;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wherewith the reaper filleth not his hand,
Nor he that bindeth sheaves, his bosom:
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: Out of the depths have I cried unto thee, O Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, hear my voice:
Let thine ears be attentive
To the voice of my supplications.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If thou, Jehovah, shouldest mark iniquities,
O Lord, who could stand?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But there is forgiveness with thee,
That thou mayest be feared.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I wait for Jehovah, my soul doth wait,
And in his word do I hope.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
And he will redeem Israel
From all his iniquities.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
O Israel, hope in Jehovah
From this time forth and for evermore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jehovah, remember for David
All his affliction;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How he sware unto Jehovah,
And vowed unto the Mighty One of Jacob:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely I will not come into the tabernacle of my house,
Nor go up into my bed;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will not give sleep to mine eyes,
Or slumber to mine eyelids;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Until I find out a place for Jehovah,
A tabernacle for the Mighty One of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lo, we heard of it in Ephrathah:
We found it in the field of the wood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We will go into his tabernacles;
We will worship at his footstool.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Arise, O Jehovah, into thy resting-place;
Thou, and the ark of thy strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let thy priests be clothed with righteousness;
And let thy saints shout for joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For thy servant Davidâ€™s sake
Turn not away the face of thine anointed.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
If thy children will keep my covenant
And my testimony that I shall teach them,
Their children also shall sit upon thy throne for evermore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For Jehovah hath chosen Zion;
He hath desired it for his habitation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is my resting-place for ever:
Here will I dwell; for I have desired it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will abundantly bless her provision:
I will satisfy her poor with bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Her priests also will I clothe with salvation;
And her saints shall shout aloud for joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There will I make the horn of David to bud:
I have ordained a lamp for mine anointed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His enemies will I clothe with shame;
But upon himself shall his crown flourish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, how good and how pleasant it is
For brethren to dwell together in unity!
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Like the dew of Hermon,
That cometh down upon the mountains of Zion:
For there Jehovah commanded the blessing,
Even life for evermore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, bless ye Jehovah, all ye servants of Jehovah,
That by night stand in the house of Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lift up your hands to the sanctuary,
And bless ye Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jehovah bless thee out of Zion;
Even he that made heaven and earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Ye that stand in the house of Jehovah,
In the courts of the house of our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise ye Jehovah; for Jehovah is good:
Sing praises unto his name; for it is pleasant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For Jehovah hath chosen Jacob unto himself,
And Israel for his own possession.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I know that Jehovah is great,
And that our Lord is above all gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whatsoever Jehovah pleased, that hath he done,
In heaven and in earth, in the seas and in all deeps;
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Who smote the first-born of Egypt,
Both of man and beast;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who sent signs and wonders into the midst of thee, O Egypt,
Upon Pharaoh, and upon all his servants;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who smote many nations,
And slew mighty kings,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sihon king of the Amorites,
And Og king of Bashan,
And all the kingdoms of Canaan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And gave their land for a heritage,
A heritage unto Israel his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thy name, O Jehovah, endureth for ever;
Thy memorial name, O Jehovah, throughout all generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For Jehovah will judge his people,
And repent himself concerning his servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The idols of the nations are silver and gold,
The work of menâ€™s hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have mouths, but they speak not;
Eyes have they, but they see not;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have ears, but they hear not;
Neither is there any breath in their mouths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They that make them shall be like unto them;
Yea, every one that trusteth in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O house of Israel, bless ye Jehovah:
O house of Aaron, bless ye Jehovah:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O house of Levi, bless ye Jehovah:
Ye that fear Jehovah, bless ye Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed be Jehovah out of Zion,
Who dwelleth at Jerusalem.
Praise ye Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh give thanks unto Jehovah; for he is good;
For his lovingkindness endureth for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh give thanks unto the God of gods;
For his lovingkindness endureth for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh give thanks unto the Lord of lords;
For his lovingkindness endureth for ever:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To him who alone doeth great wonders;
For his lovingkindness endureth for ever:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To him that by understanding made the heavens;
For his lovingkindness endureth for ever:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To him that spread forth the earth above the waters;
For his lovingkindness endureth for ever:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To him that made great lights;
For his lovingkindness endureth for ever:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sun to rule by day;
For his lovingkindness endureth for ever;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The moon and stars to rule by night;
For his lovingkindness endureth for ever:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To him that smote Egypt in their first-born;
For his lovingkindness endureth for ever;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And brought out Israel from among them;
For his lovingkindness endureth for ever;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With a strong hand, and with an outstretched arm;
For his lovingkindness endureth for ever:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To him that divided the Red Sea in sunder;
For his lovingkindness endureth for ever;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And made Israel to pass through the midst of it;
For his lovingkindness endureth for ever;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But overthrew Pharaoh and his host in the Red Sea;
For his lovingkindness endureth for ever:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To him that led his people through the wilderness;
For his lovingkindness endureth for ever:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To him that smote great kings;
For his lovingkindness endureth for ever;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And slew famous kings;
For his lovingkindness endureth for ever:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sihon king of the Amorites;
For his lovingkindness endureth for ever;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And Og king of Bashan;
For his lovingkindness endureth for ever;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And gave their land for a heritage;
For his lovingkindness endureth for ever;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even a heritage unto Israel his servant;
For his lovingkindness endureth for ever:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who remembered us in our low estate;
For his lovingkindness endureth for ever;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And hath delivered us from our adversaries;
For his lovingkindness endureth for ever:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who giveth food to all flesh;
For his lovingkindness endureth for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh give thanks unto the God of heaven;
For his lovingkindness endureth for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By the rivers of Babylon,
There we sat down, yea, we wept,
When we remembered Zion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Upon the willows in the midst thereof
We hanged up our harps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For there they that led us captive required of us songs,
And they that wasted us required of us mirth, saying,
Sing us one of the songs of Zion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How shall we sing Jehovahâ€™s song
In a foreign land?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I forget thee, O Jerusalem,
Let my right hand forget her skill.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let my tongue cleave to the roof of my mouth,
If I remember thee not;
If I prefer not Jerusalem
Above my chief joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remember, O Jehovah, against the children of Edom
The day of Jerusalem;
Who said, Rase it, rase it,
Even to the foundation thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O daughter of Babylon, that art to be destroyed,
Happy shall he be, that rewardeth thee
As thou hast served us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Happy shall he be, that taketh and dasheth thy little ones
Against the rock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will give thee thanks with my whole heart:
Before the gods will I sing praises unto thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will worship toward thy holy temple,
And give thanks unto thy name for thy lovingkindness and for thy truth:
For thou hast magnified thy word above all thy name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the day that I called thou answeredst me,
Thou didst encourage me with strength in my soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All the kings of the earth shall give thee thanks, O Jehovah,
For they have heard the words of thy mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yea, they shall sing of the ways of Jehovah;
For great is the glory of Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For though Jehovah is high, yet hath he respect unto the lowly;
But the haughty he knoweth from afar.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: O Jehovah, thou hast searched me, and known me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou knowest my downsitting and mine uprising;
Thou understandest my thought afar off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou searchest out my path and my lying down,
And art acquainted with all my ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For there is not a word in my tongue,
But, lo, O Jehovah, thou knowest it altogether.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou hast beset me behind and before,
And laid thy hand upon me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Such knowledge is too wonderful for me;
It is high, I cannot attain unto it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whither shall I go from thy Spirit?
Or whither shall I flee from thy presence?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I ascend up into heaven, thou art there:
If I make my bed in Sheol, behold, thou art there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I take the wings of the morning,
And dwell in the uttermost parts of the sea;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even there shall thy hand lead me,
And thy right hand shall hold me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I say, Surely the darkness shall overwhelm me,
And the light about me shall be night;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even the darkness hideth not from thee,
But the night shineth as the day:
The darkness and the light are both alike to thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For thou didst form my inward parts:
Thou didst cover me in my motherâ€™s womb.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
My frame was not hidden from thee,
When I was made in secret,
And curiously wrought in the lowest parts of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thine eyes did see mine unformed substance;
And in thy book they were all written,
Even the days that were ordained for me,
When as yet there was none of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How precious also are thy thoughts unto me, O God!
How great is the sum of them!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I should count them, they are more in number than the sand:
When I awake, I am still with thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely thou wilt slay the wicked, O God:
Depart from me therefore, ye bloodthirsty men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For they speak against thee wickedly,
And thine enemies take thy name in vain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not I hate them, O Jehovah, that hate thee?
And am not I grieved with those that rise up against thee?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I hate them with perfect hatred:
They are become mine enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Search me, O God, and know my heart:
Try me, and know my thoughts;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And see if there be any wicked way in me,
And lead me in the way everlasting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Deliver me, O Jehovah, from the evil man;
Preserve me from the violent man:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who devise mischiefs in their heart;
Continually do they gather themselves together for war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have sharpened their tongue like a serpent;
Addersâ€™ poison is under their lips. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I said unto Jehovah, Thou art my God:
Give ear unto the voice of my supplications, O Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Jehovah the Lord, the strength of my salvation,
Thou hast covered my head in the day of battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Grant not, O Jehovah, the desires of the wicked;
Further not his evil device, lest they exalt themselves. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As for the head of those that compass me about,
Let the mischief of their own lips cover them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let burning coals fall upon them:
Let them be cast into the fire,
Into deep pits, whence they shall not rise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
An evil speaker shall not be established in the earth:
Evil shall hunt the violent man to overthrow him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I know that Jehovah will maintain the cause of the afflicted,
And justice for the needy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely the righteous shall give thanks unto thy name:
The upright shall dwell in thy presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jehovah, I have called upon thee; make haste unto me:
Give ear unto my voice, when I call unto thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let my prayer be set forth as incense before thee;
The lifting up of my hands as the evening sacrifice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Set a watch, O Jehovah, before my mouth;
Keep the door of my lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Incline not my heart to any evil thing,
To practise deeds of wickedness
With men that work iniquity:
And let me not eat of their dainties.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Their judges are thrown down by the sides of the rock;
And they shall hear my words; for they are sweet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As when one ploweth and cleaveth the earth,
Our bones are scattered at the mouth of Sheol.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For mine eyes are unto thee, O Jehovah the Lord:
In thee do I take refuge; leave not my soul destitute.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Keep me from the snare which they have laid for me,
And from the gins of the workers of iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the wicked fall into their own nets,
Whilst that I withal escape.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I cry with my voice unto Jehovah;
With my voice unto Jehovah do I make supplication.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I pour out my complaint before him;
I show before him my trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When my spirit was overwhelmed within me,
Thou knewest my path.
In the way wherein I walk
Have they hidden a snare for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Bring my soul out of prison,
That I may give thanks unto thy name:
The righteous shall compass me about;
For thou wilt deal bountifully with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear my prayer, O Jehovah; give ear to my supplications:
In thy faithfulness answer me, and in thy righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And enter not into judgment with thy servant;
For in thy sight no man living is righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore is my spirit overwhelmed within me;
My heart within me is desolate.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I spread forth my hands unto thee:
My soul thirsteth after thee, as a weary land. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Make haste to answer me, O Jehovah; my spirit faileth:
Hide not thy face from me,
Lest I become like them that go down into the pit.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Deliver me, O Jehovah, from mine enemies:
I flee unto thee to hide me.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Quicken me, O Jehovah, for thy nameâ€™s sake:
In thy righteousness bring my soul out of trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed be Jehovah my rock,
Who teacheth my hands to war,
And my fingers to fight:
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Jehovah, what is man, that thou takest knowledge of him?
Or the son of man, that thou makest account of him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Man is like to vanity:
His days are as a shadow that passeth away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bow thy heavens, O Jehovah, and come down:
Touch the mountains, and they shall smoke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Cast forth lightning, and scatter them;
Send out thine arrows, and discomfit them.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Whose mouth speaketh deceit,
And whose right hand is a right hand of falsehood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will sing a new song unto thee, O God:
Upon a psaltery of ten strings will I sing praises unto thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou art he that giveth salvation unto kings;
Who rescueth David his servant from the hurtful sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rescue me, and deliver me out of the hand of aliens,
Whose mouth speaketh deceit,
And whose right hand is a right hand of falsehood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When our sons shall be as plants grown up in their youth,
And our daughters as corner-stones hewn after the fashion of a palace;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When our garners are full, affording all manner of store,
And our sheep bring forth thousands and ten thousands in our fields;
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Happy is the people that is in such a case;
Yea, happy is the people whose God is Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will extol thee, my God, O King;
And I will bless thy name for ever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Every day will I bless thee;
And I will praise thy name for ever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Great is Jehovah, and greatly to be praised;
And his greatness is unsearchable.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
One generation shall laud thy works to another,
And shall declare thy mighty acts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Of the glorious majesty of thine honor,
And of thy wondrous works, will I meditate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And men shall speak of the might of thy terrible acts;
And I will declare thy greatness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They shall utter the memory of thy great goodness,
And shall sing of thy righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jehovah is gracious, and merciful;
Slow to anger, and of great lovingkindness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jehovah is good to all;
And his tender mercies are over all his works.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All thy works shall give thanks unto thee, O Jehovah;
And thy saints shall bless thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They shall speak of the glory of thy kingdom,
And talk of thy power;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To make known to the sons of men his mighty acts,
And the glory of the majesty of his kingdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thy kingdom is an everlasting kingdom,
And thy dominion endureth throughout all generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jehovah upholdeth all that fall,
And raiseth up all those that are bowed down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The eyes of all wait for thee;
And thou givest them their food in due season.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou openest thy hand,
And satisfiest the desire of every living thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jehovah is righteous in all his ways,
And gracious in all his works.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jehovah is nigh unto all them that call upon him,
To all that call upon him in truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will fulfil the desire of them that fear him;
He also will hear their cry and will save them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jehovah preserveth all them that love him;
But all the wicked will he destroy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My mouth shall speak the praise of Jehovah;
And let all flesh bless his holy name for ever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise ye Jehovah.
Praise Jehovah, O my soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
While I live will I praise Jehovah:
I will sing praises unto my God while I have any being.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Put not your trust in princes,
Nor in the son of man, in whom there is no help.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His breath goeth forth, he returneth to his earth;
In that very day his thoughts perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Happy is he that hath the God of Jacob for his help,
Whose hope is in Jehovah his God:
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Jehovah will reign for ever,
Thy God, O Zion, unto all generations.
Praise ye Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Jehovah doth build up Jerusalem;
He gathereth together the outcasts of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He healeth the broken in heart,
And bindeth up their wounds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He counteth the number of the stars;
He calleth them all by their names.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Great is our Lord, and mighty in power;
His understanding is infinite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jehovah upholdeth the meek:
He bringeth the wicked down to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing unto Jehovah with thanksgiving;
Sing praises upon the harp unto our God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who covereth the heavens with clouds,
Who prepareth rain for the earth,
Who maketh grass to grow upon the mountains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He giveth to the beast his food,
And to the young ravens which cry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He delighteth not in the strength of the horse:
He taketh no pleasure in the legs of a man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jehovah taketh pleasure in them that fear him,
In those that hope in his lovingkindness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise Jehovah, O Jerusalem;
Praise thy God, O Zion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he hath strengthened the bars of thy gates;
He hath blessed thy children within thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He maketh peace in thy borders;
He filleth thee with the finest of the wheat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He sendeth out his commandment upon earth;
His word runneth very swiftly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He giveth snow like wool;
He scattereth the hoar-frost like ashes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He casteth forth his ice like morsels:
Who can stand before his cold?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He sendeth out his word, and melteth them:
He causeth his wind to blow, and the waters flow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He showeth his word unto Jacob,
His statutes and his ordinances unto Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Praise ye Jehovah.
Praise ye Jehovah from the heavens:
Praise him in the heights.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise ye him, all his angels:
Praise ye him, all his host.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise ye him, sun and moon:
Praise him, all ye stars of light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise him, ye heavens of heavens,
And ye waters that are above the heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them praise the name of Jehovah;
For he commanded, and they were created.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He hath also established them for ever and ever:
He hath made a decree which shall not pass away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise Jehovah from the earth,
Ye sea-monsters, and all deeps;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Fire and hail, snow and vapor;
Stormy wind, fulfilling his word;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Mountains and all hills;
Fruitful trees and all cedars;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Beasts and all cattle;
Creeping things and flying birds;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Kings of the earth and all peoples;
Princes and all judges of the earth;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Both young men and virgins;
Old men and children:
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
And he hath lifted up the horn of his people,
The praise of all his saints;
Even of the children of Israel, a people near unto him.
Praise ye Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise ye Jehovah.
Sing unto Jehovah a new song,
And his praise in the assembly of the saints.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let Israel rejoice in him that made him:
Let the children of Zion be joyful in their King.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them praise his name in the dance:
Let them sing praises unto him with timbrel and harp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For Jehovah taketh pleasure in his people:
He will beautify the meek with salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the saints exult in glory:
Let them sing for joy upon their beds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the high praises of God be in their mouth,
And a two-edged sword in their hand;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To execute vengeance upon the nations,
And punishments upon the peoples;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To bind their kings with chains,
And their nobles with fetters of iron;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To execute upon them the judgment written:
This honor have all his saints.
Praise ye Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise ye Jehovah.
Praise God in his sanctuary:
Praise him in the firmament of his power.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise him for his mighty acts:
Praise him according to his excellent greatness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise him with trumpet sound:
Praise him with psaltery and harp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise him with timbrel and dance:
Praise him with stringed instruments and pipe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise him with loud cymbals:
Praise him with high sounding cymbals.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let everything that hath breath praise Jehovah.
Praise ye Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator
